summary: This is an email from Christian Everdell of Cohen & Gresser LLP to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding discovery issues in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The email details problems with unreadable discovery files provided to Maxwell at MDC and requests new hard drives with corrected files be delivered to her.

events.title: Discovery Issues Communication
events.description: Christian Everdell sends an email to the U.S. Attorney's Office detailing problems with unreadable discovery files provided to Ghislaine Maxwell at MDC and requesting new hard drives with corrected files.

locations: New York, NY 10022 (Cohen & Gresser LLP office address)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team was experiencing technical difficulties accessing discovery materials provided by the government while she was incarcerated at MDC.
The defense team planned to ship two new hard drives (one with on-board encryption, one without) to the U.S. Attorney's Office to have a corrected set of discovery files loaded.
The defense specifically requested replacement copies of documents in the 'LSJ' subfolder of the 'Search warrant photos' folder from the most recent production.
The correspondence highlights logistical challenges in providing discovery to an incarcerated defendant in a high-profile case.
